001package imagingbook.lib.filter.linear;
002
003import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
004
005/**
006 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
007 * 
008 * @author WB
009 * @version 2020/12/29
010 */
011public class Kernel2D {
012        
013        private final float[][] H;      // H[y][x] !!
014        private final int xc, yc;
015        private final int width, height;
016        
017        /**
018         * Convenience constructor.
019         * Assumes that the kernel's hot spot is at its center,
020         * does normalization by default.
021         * 
022         * @param H the 2D kernel array
023         */
024        public Kernel2D(float[][] H) {
025                this(H, (H[0].length - 1) / 2, (H.length - 1) / 2, true);
026        }
027        
028        /**
029         * Full constructor.
030         * 
031         * @param H the 2D kernel array
032         * @param xc the x-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (width-1)/2
033         * @param yc the y-coordinate of the kernel's hot spot, default is (height-1)/2
034         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
035         */
036        public Kernel2D(float[][] H, int xc, int yc, boolean normalize) {
037                this.H = (normalize) ? normalize(H) : Matrix.duplicate(H);
038                this.width = H[0].length;
039                this.height = H.length;
040                this.xc = xc;
041                this.yc = yc;
042                validate();
043        }
044        
045        /**
046         * Creates the effective 2D kernel from two 1D kernels.
047         * 
048         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
049         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
050         * @param normalize if true the kernel is normalized (to sum = 1)
051         */
052        public Kernel2D(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy, boolean normalize) {
053                this(getEffectiveKernel(Hx, Hy), Hx.getXc(), Hy.getXc(), normalize);
054        }
055        
056        /**
057         * Calculates the effective 2D kernel array from two 1D kernels
058         * assumed to be applied in x- and y-direction, respectively.
059         * The result is not normalized.
060         * Use the constructor {@link #Kernel2D(Kernel1D, Kernel1D, boolean)}
061         * to create the equivalent (optionally normalized) 2D kernel.
062         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
063         * 
064         * @param Hx the 1D kernel for the x-direction
065         * @param Hy the 1D kernel for the y-direction
066         * @return the effective 2D kernel matrix
067         */
068        public static float[][] getEffectiveKernel(Kernel1D Hx, Kernel1D Hy) {
069                float[] kernelX = Hx.getH();
070                float[] kernelY = Hy.getH();
071                
072                float[][] kernel = new float[kernelX.length][kernelY.length];
073                for (int y = 0; y < kernelY.length; y++) {
074                        for (int x = 0; x < kernelX.length; x++) {
075                                kernel[y][x] = kernelX[x] * kernelY[y];
076                        }
077                }
078                return kernel;
079        }
080        
081        private void validate() {
082                if (!Matrix.isRectangular(H))
083                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("non-rectangular filter kernel");
084                // TODO: should we check if xc/yc is inside the kernel? does it matter?
085        }
086        
087        /**
088         * Returns the kernel's 2D array.
089         * Note that the kernel coordinates are {@code H[y][x]}.
090         * @return the kernel's 2D array
091         */
092        public float[][] getH() {
093                return H;
094        }
095        
096        /**
097         * Returns the width of this kernel.
098         * @return the kernel's width
099         */
100        public int getWidth() {
101                return width;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * Returns the height of this kernel.
106         * @return the kernel's height
107         */
108        public int getHeight() {
109                return height;
110        }
111        
112        /**
113         * Returns the horizontal center coordinate of this kernel.
114         * @return the kernel's x-center coordinate
115         */
116        public int getXc() {
117                return xc;
118        }
119        
120        /**
121         * Returns the vertical center coordinate of this kernel.
122         * @return the kernel's y-center coordinate
123         */
124        public int getYc() {
125                return yc;
126        }
127        
128        // ----------------------------------------------------------
129        
130        /**
131         * Normalizes the specified array such that its sum becomes 1.
132         * Throws an exception if the array's sum is zero.
133         * The original array is not modified.
134         * 
135         * @param A a 2D array
136         * @return the normalized array
137         */
138        public static float[][] normalize(float[][] A) throws ArithmeticException {
139                float s = (float) (1.0 / Matrix.sum(A));
140                if (!Double.isFinite(s))
141                        throw new ArithmeticException("zero kernel sum, cannot normalize");
142                return Matrix.multiply(s, A);
143        }
144
145}
